abstract:
I've had the special experience to, in an extraordinarily short amount
of time, move from studying code independently to working full time on a
customer-facing technical support team, to working as an full-stack
engineer, to finally, leading an organization as Director of
Engineering. In each transition, I've had to learn and use certain work
skills to both get the current job done and prepare myself for my next.
Come hear what attitudes, behaviors, work habits, and lessons I learned
and chose to take with me, and what I intentionally left behind, as I
made these transitions -- and consider what you might take and leave
behind in your own journey.
title: From Support to Engineering and Beyond: What to Take with You, and What to Leave Behind
